title: Port of Los Angeles: The Importance of Collaboration
text:
Gate Automation Engineering Port of Los Angeles: The Importance of Collaboration 28 Sep 2015 Automation and Optimisation , Cargo Volumes and Throughput , Container Handling , Containers , Environment , Finance , Global Economy/Trade , Going Places , Mega Ship Ready , Politics , Port Governance , Port Planning , Ports , Shipping PTI recently interviewed Port of Los Angeles CEO Gene Seroka on a wide range of topics, each a ‘hot button’ industry issue. In this segment Mr Seroka articulates the ways in which the Port of Los Angeles collaborates with partners, stakeholders and nodes across the supply chain to create the dialogue that nurtures the solutions the industry needs. 
As CEO of the busiest port in the US the challenges Mr Seroka faces are unique, yet by collaborating with neighbour the Port of Long Beach , the second busiest port in the US in the form of a supply chain optimisation group, he strives to bring greater visibility across the chain. 
Other areas Mr Seroka highlights that bring greater visibility include dialogue with rail and truck services, as well as the practice of ‘block stowage’, which is greater organisation when a ship is primarily loaded. 
Taking into account all the players and nodes across the supply chain, Mr Seroka outlines how his port aims to be the “entity that brings folks together” to create solutions that benefit everybody.
